SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc

Package org.klojang.jdbc

package org.klojang.jdbc
Database utilities aimed at providing a quick route for database data to be inserted into Klojang templates.
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    org.klojang.jdbc.util
    JDBC utility classes.
  • Class
    Description
    BatchInsert<T>
    BatchInsert specializes in saving large batches of JavaBeans or records to the database.
    BatchInsertBuilder
    A builder class for BatchInsert instances.
    BatchQuery<T>
    Facilitates the processing of large query results in batches across multiple, isolated requests.
    BatchQuery.QueryId
    Functions as an identifier for a persistent query.
    BeanExtractor<T>
    Converts the rows in a JDBC ResultSet into JavaBeans, records or Map<String, Object> pseudo-objects.
    BeanExtractorFactory<T>
    A factory for BeanExtractor instances.
    BeanValueProcessor<T>
    Used to selectively modify values within a batch of JavaBeans or records.
    CustomBinder
    A CustomBinder gives you full control over how a value is bound to a PreparedStatement.
    CustomReader
    A CustomReader gives you full control over how a value is extracted from a ResultSet.
    DatabaseException
    A RuntimeException that may either wrap a SQLException or indicate another error condition while processing or executing SQL.
    ExtractorFactory<T>
    Specifies the capacities of BeanExtractor factory objects.
    InsertBuilder
    A Builder class for SQLInsert instances.
    MapExtractor
    Converts the rows in a JDBC ResultSet into Map<String, Object> pseudo-objects.
    MapExtractorFactory
    A factory for MapExtractor instances.
    Quoter
    Escapes and quotes values according to the quoting rules of the target database.
    SessionConfig
    SessionConfig objects allow you to fine-tune or modify various aspects of how Klojang JDBC processes and executes SQL.
    SQL
    Encapsulates a user-provided SQL statement.
    SQLExpression
    A special string wrapper object whose type signals to Klojang JDBC that the wrapped string must be treated as a native SQL expression and hence must not be escaped or quoted.
    SQLInsert
    Facilitates the execution of SQL INSERT statements.
    SQLQuery
    Facilitates the execution of SQL SELECT statements.
    SQLSession
    A SQLSession allows you to provide values for template variables within an SQL template.
    SQLStatement<T extends SQLStatement<T>>
    Abstract base class for SQLQuery, SQLInsert and SQLUpdate.
    SQLUpdate
    Facilitates the execution of UPDATE, DELETE, and DDL statements.
